required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Analysis of T Cell Metabolism in Relapsed AML Patients With DLIs and Bicanorm Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Analysis of T Cell Metabolism and Immune Phenotype in Relapsed Acute Myeloid Leukemia Patients Receiving Donor Lymphocyte Infusions and Bicanorm (Sodium Bicarbonate)

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, the outcomes of relapsed AML patients receiving DLIs and Bicanorm (Sodium bicarbonate) were analyzed including T cell metabolism and immune phenotype.

detailed_description.textblock:
Acute myeloid leukemia (AML) patients suffering from relapse after allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplantation (allo-HCT) have a poor survival outcome. Donor lymphocyte infusions (DLIs) to induce graft-versus-leukemia (GvL) effects have a limited survival benefit.
Extensive preclinical studies have shown a beneficial effect of sodium bicarbonate on metabolic fitness of leukemia-reactive T cells in GvL AML models. Therefore, the investigators aimed to investigate a potential benefit of Bicanorm (Sodium bicarbonate) treatment accompanying DLIs in relapsed AML patients. The investigators determined the metabolic and immune phenotype of T cells isolated from patients receiving DLIs before and after Bicanorm (Sodium bicarbonate) treatment.

primary_outcome.description: Extracellular acidification rate (ECAR) determined by live-cell metabolic assay using the Seahorse Analyzer
Oxygen consumption rate (OCR) determined by live-cell metabolic assay using the Seahorse Analyzer
T cell cytokine and effector molecule production determined by flow cytometric analysis

arm_group.arm_group_label: AML relapse under DLI and Bicanorm treatment
arm_group.description: Analysis of T cell metabolism, immune phenotype and serum pH before and after Bicanorm (Sodium bicarbonate) treatment.

intervention.description: Treatment of patients with relapsed AML after allo-HCT receiving DLIs with Bicanorm (1-1-1) for 7 days. sodium hydrogen carbonate (1 g per 1 tablet) = sodium ion (11,9 mmol per 1 tablet) = sodium ion (273 mg per 1 tablet) = hydrogen carbonate ion (11,9 mmol per 1 tablet)
intervention.arm_group_label: AML relapse under DLI and Bicanorm treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- confirmed AML relapse after allo-HCT
- patients receiving DLIs
- age ≥ 18 years
- written informed consent
- ability to understand the nature of the study and the study related procedures and to comply with them
Exclusion Criteria:
- age < 18 years
- lack of informed consent
